attributes.action: Improve the treatment and diagnosis of Thoracic Outlet Syndrome on the NHS.
attributes.background: TOS is a condition in which the flow of blood or nerves are restricted to one or both arms. Despite the fact it creates debilitating and disabling symptoms, at present the current understanding and treatment on the NHS is very poor, often taking several years to even diagnose, if at all.
attributes.additional_details:
It can cause a range of symptoms including the pulse completely dropping from the limb as soon as it is raised, to extreme weakness and pain in the affected side. In rare cases it can even lead to blood clots and strokes.

I have personally been experiencing symptoms for 3 years, having initially been told by a doctor I was "imagining" my symptoms, which is a very common, devastating reaction faced by sufferers. The condition is serious and often requires the removal of a rib to treat.

attributes.action: Stop sending our Foreign aid money to countries with no animal rights
attributes.background: We give huge sums of our taxes to countries like China, Vietnam, Pakistan etc where animals both domestic and farmed are given no protection whatsoever from abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Countless petitions to these Governments pleading to stop atrocities like Yulin Dog Eating 'Festival' or Vietnamese slaughtering cattle with a sledgehammer seem to fall on deaf ears. I propose we stop our taxes being donated as foreign aid to these countries and I believe that 'money talks' so perhaps they will listen!
Sign and share please, let's see where this goes!

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: A Public Inquiry into the Management and Governance of the UK's Universities
attributes.background: 2017/18 saw the longest university strike ever, over slashed pensions. Students lost classes,  staff  pay.  An independent Joint Expert Panel has found small tweaks, as suggested by staff, would save the pension scheme. The strike was only due to university bosses' insistence on confrontation.
attributes.additional_details:
UK university Vice Chancellors get mega-salaries.  Many unis now employ more administrators and managers than lecturers and researchers.  There is a massive secret network of lobby groups/ consultancies.  This superstructure is all funded by the debt enforced on our children as student loans, and taxpayer’s money. Yet the expert panel's findings suggest it is not up to the job.

A Public Inquiry is need to restore good teaching and research for the public good in Britain's Universities.

attributes.action: Review maternity and paternity law for birth of premature babies
attributes.background: I feel there should be extended leave for mothers maternity i.e paid leave from when the baby is born and then maternity leave to start once the baby is medically discharged and also for fathers to I.e 2 weeks off for baby being born and also 2 weeks from when they are medically discharged.
attributes.additional_details: My wife had a emergency c section on the 16th September to our 28 week old baby son called Finley. We have been in hospital for over 8 weeks and hopefully be home by the end of November. I as a parent have no parental leave for when my baby comes home and my wife has already lost 2 months of her maternity leave and our baby isn’t out of hospital yet.

attributes.action: Get rid of the 5% luxury tax that women have to pay on sanitary products.
attributes.background: It is discrimination against women to have to pay a luxury tax on a necessity, as men do not have to pay for any necessities. Many young girls miss out on their education because they're unable to afford sanitary items to wear.
attributes.additional_details: Our goal is to get rid of the 5% luxury tax that women have to pay on sanitary products as people can't afford it.

attributes.action: Urge the Libyan Government to appoint a different Libyan ambassador to London.
attributes.background: It has been announced that the Libyan unity government in Tripoli has appointed  a new Libyan ambassador to London, this designation has brought lots of outrage within the Libyan community in the UK as well as in Libya .
attributes.additional_details: As individual and part of the Libyan- British community in the UK,we would like to raise a great concern over the new designation role with the UK government, although enabling him for such vital position would cause lots of problems in the future relationship between the two countries and bring lots of shame and valuations to the Libyan people’s human rights. A position of Ambassador to a state like Great Britain should be given to someone who is qualified.

attributes.action: Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field to be used when selling bicycles on web sites.
attributes.background: Many stolen bicycles are sold on second hand web sites. It is almost impossible to identify bikes on these sites. Therefore a Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field must be filled in when selling bicycles on these sites, without the number being given the item cant be advertised e.g. Ebay Gumtree etc.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cot bumpers in the UK
attributes.background: Cot bumpers are extremely dangerous and have taken innocent childrens lives. They are not needed and most of them are made to be pretty to entice you to buy them.

attributes.action: Provide bereavement benefits for unmarried partners of 10 years or more.
attributes.background: Shawn and I were together for 26 years. He died on 31st March. It is unfair that bereavement allowances and payments are only for married couples and civil partners.
attributes.additional_details: People who are in a relationship for many years share the same costs and have the same financial responsibilities as married or civilly partnered people. They may have joint bank accounts and mortgages. They need the same rights to assistance when they lose their life partner.

attributes.action: Increase funding for schools with SEN students.
attributes.background: We are a GCSE Citizenship group and we feel that, due to the recent school budget cuts, Special education needs students are not getting the full support that they deserve, because the funding has been cut for them.
attributes.additional_details:
Our school has been greatly effected by the cuts, and we are now having to use other students money to support these SEN students. If this cause was bought before Parliament, we could increase the spending on SEN students and they would not have to suffer any more than they already are. We have lost £279 per student and we are losing more to help other students.

Our aims are to get as many signatures as possible and hopefully get local MP's behind us.
Please help us.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to carry any knife in public without good reason.
attributes.background: A knife point can cause serious injury or kill at a depth of just 2cm . Therefore why is it legal to carry a knife that has a folding blade with a cutting edge 3 inches long or less. No knife should be carried on UK streets.

attributes.action: Give my parents visa to attend my graduation ceremony and see my wee girl Nara
attributes.background: Please help me have my parents attend my graduation ceremony and meet their new born granddaughter Nara. My parents require a visa to enter the UK and their recent visa applications have been refused. There is no right of appeal, hence I have started this petition. I believe the refusal is unfair
attributes.additional_details:
Their visit visa applications have been refused for what I believe wrong reasons.
Both my parents are over 60 years old and have lived their entire lives in their hometown, yet this is what they have received in the refusal letter:
“Given this, I am not satisfied that you are settled or established, or that you have shown sufficiently strong social or economic ties to your country of residence...”
Really?! Then what would be considered as “settled” or having “strong social or economic ties”?!

attributes.action: Require all fast food restaurants & coffee shops to use paper lids on drinks.
attributes.background: The UN has cofirmed that there is just 12 years left to reverse the damage done to our climate. Plastic is a huge contributing factor to the damage that has already taken place. Following paper straws, we need to introduce paper lids to reduce unnessecary plastic usage!
attributes.additional_details:
United Nations Report: http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

https://www.theloop.ca/we-only-have-12-years-left-to-fix-climate-change-before-were-totally-screwed/

How plastic is damaging the earth:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/environment/plastic-how-planet-earth-environment-oceans-wildlife-recycling-landfill-artificial-a7972226.html%3famp

BBC’s “Drowning in Plastic” documentes the damage that has occurred through plastic usage.

attributes.action: Make GCSE English Literature open book and give all formulae for other exams.
attributes.background: Exam boards say that the new 9-1 GCSE exams are 'not a memory test' but rather 'an assessment of skill'. However, students are not given formulae and studied literature texts in exams, thus making them memory tests. This puts unnecessary pressure on students, and leads to deteriorated mental health.

attributes.action: Include black role models as part of history education throughout the year.
attributes.background: Black history is not a compulsory part of UK education – we are asking the government to look at the positive impact of including important black role models as part of history education throughout the academic year.

attributes.action: Take greater action to improve young people's mental health in the UK
attributes.background: More than 100,000 14-year-olds in the UK self-harm. We the undersigned call for Parliament to respond by adopting new Children's Society guidelines (such as requiring a counsellor in every secondary school) so all young people can access the support for their mental health they need.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/good_childhood_summary_2018.pdf
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-45329030
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/aug/29/quarter-of-14-year-old-girls-in-uk-have-self-harmed-report-finds

attributes.action: Provide annual Breast Screening and handheld mammogram machines at GP Surgeries.
attributes.background: For many years women have been offered Breast Screening every 3 years. It is a National Statistic that women have been diagnosed with Breast Cancer between Screenings and most are deemed as not 'at risk' i.e., they do not have family history. Cancer is indiscriminate and can occur between Screening.
attributes.additional_details: Recently several women who have this disease found a change in their breasts themselves, had they not, their lives would be at risk of a higher Stage of Cancer or die before their next scheduled Screening. 3 years is too long, it is the difference between life and death. Other Countries do mammograms annually logically Early Stage treatment must cost less than treatment if left. There are cheaper handheld mammogram machines which could be put in GP Surgeries so annual Screening can be supported.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wet wipes that have “flushable” on the packet.
attributes.background:
According the the BBC,“All wet wipes sold as flushable in the UK have failed the industrys disintergration test”. “Flushable” wet wipes cause 80% of blockages in sewers and cost around £100m a year.
This money could be reinvested into our ageing infrastructure and could prevent more ocean pollution

attributes.action: Introduce a Tax on and revoke VAT exemption for beef products
attributes.background:
Countless scientists have identified excessive beef consumption as both a major threat to our planet, and to our health. If we introduce a tax on beef products we could:

1) Decrease consumption
2) Raise money for schools and hospitals
3) Save the planet
attributes.additional_details: The specific amount for the tax should be debated in parliament, however a guideline would be 1p per gram of beef which would be charged to the retailer. This would be on top of the standard VAT rate.

attributes.action: Put mandatory ethical labelling on all imported consumer goods
attributes.background: The British Government should introduce a compulsory ‘ethical labelling’ system on all imported items, similar to the ‘traffic-light’ system used in food.This would cover four areas of concern: worker pay; human welfare; environmental impact and animal cruelty.
attributes.additional_details: This labelling would empower shoppers who are unknowingly helping to destroy the environment and exploit some of the poorest workers in the developing world by buying products which they do not know are unethical. Industries from food to fashion are relentlessly driving for profit no matter what the cost. A new easily understood and comprehensive system of labelling would inform decisions and transform the lives of millions of people.

attributes.action: Allow HRT to be prescribed free of charge.
attributes.background: We have an aging workforce and women are now working through the Menopause which is not a life choice or self inflicted. HRT is a lifeline to many, allowing them to remain in employment. Despite working many struggle financially so receiving HRT free of charge would help the women and the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Baroness Altham published a report on women in the workforce and stated older women (aged 50 to 64) are now more likely to be in employment with the proportion of those in jobs reaching a record high in 2015 of 64.2% compared to just 41.9% in 1985.
Menopause usually starts between 45 and 55 so many women  are trying to remain in work while dealing with Menopause symptoms that can be  disabling. For many HRT allows them to remain productive and reduces the risk of various other health conditions.

attributes.action: Grant Gibraltar special designated status that would keep it within the EU.
attributes.background: Political tensions have risen again over Gibraltar's status since Brexit, & without a credible answer, we could see their people suffer the consequences of leaving the EU worse than any other place in the UK's jurisdiction.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/gibraltar-brexit-northern-ireland-border-spain-theresa-may-a8234516.html
 
http://uk.businessinsider.com/why-the-tiny-territory-of-gibraltar-could-be-the-next-sticking-point-in-brexit-negotiations-2018-6
 
http://www.gibraltarolivepress.com/2016/09/12/chief-minister-fabian-picardo-says-british-means-british-at-national-day-political-rally/

attributes.action: Cyclists - Make it mandatory for bicycles to have registration license plates
attributes.background: After years driving on UK roads, it is a very widely known fact that it is very difficult for cyclists to be held accountable for their traffic offences, such as running through red traffic lights and riding recklessly on pavements putting pedestrians at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/08/40-cyclists-jump-red-light-in-30-seconds--video/ 
https://www.ft.com/content/d430ddc2-4936-11e8-8ae9-4b5ddcca99b3

attributes.action: Make it law for all property floors to be soundproofed if above another property
attributes.background: Property in the UK, especially in London can be very close to one another. If you live beneath someone in a flat and they haven’t got efficient soundproofing it can be a nuisance even though the people above aren’t doing anything wrong.
attributes.additional_details: I lived in a property for three years where the noises from above became a constant nuisance. All they were doing was walking but it was an awful noise, especially at night when they would be awake at 1am. My anger was not directed at my neighbours but at the law not looking after people living beneath other people.

attributes.action: Freeze rail fares across British service providers in January 2019
attributes.background: This petition asks the Government to commit to a "fares freeze" for regulated fares next year, as rail fares are expected to increase by 3.2% in 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite the lack of service improvements, failure to deliver compensation, the disruption caused by new timetables, consumers are still being told that fare increases are justified.

National Punctuality (PPM) in Q4 of 2017 was recorded at 86.4%, indicating a decline of 27pp compared to 2016-17. (Source: orr.gov.uk)

National Reliability (CaSL) in Q4 of 2017 was 4.8%, which also indicates a drop in quality of service and a decrease of 1.4pp compared to 2016-17. (Source: orr.gov.uk)

The ORR also discovered that 59% of consumers that made complaints to National Rail providers in 2017-18 were dissatisfied with the outcome of their complaint.

This petition proposes that all regulated train fares are frozen in January 2019.

attributes.action: Make all marketing of processed meats aimed at children illegal
attributes.background: With evidence now showing processed meats to be a group one carcinogen; meaning they are known to cause cancer, we cannot stand by and allow companies to profit from these products by marketing them to our children at the cost of their health.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanonc/article/PIIS1470-2045(15)00444-1/abstract

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/06/24/superman-batman-wonder-woman-recruited-food-giant-bid-counteract/amp/

attributes.action: Raise the max speed limit on motorways to 110 mph.
attributes.background: Due to the increasing tech of today's cars it becoming more and more unsafe to have an enforced 70 mph speed limit on UK motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
70 mph speed limits were introduced in 1965 when car wheels looked more like today's bicycle wheels. Technology has moved on unbelievable amounts in the subsequent over half a century, and is tried tested and proven to be safe at speeds exceeding 70 mph.
The mixture of the 70 mph speed limit and today's tech and ease of speed in cars erodes away at our famous British ability to maintain safe lane discipline on our motorways.

attributes.action: Have another general election
attributes.background: I don't believe that May is the correct person to take the UK forward and would therefore like another general election.

attributes.action: Develop an Isle Of Wight Airport for potential Commercial Airline use
attributes.background:
The Isle Of Wight is in the unfortunate position of having very expensive and unreliable ferries as the only way to get to and from it at present.
This is why it really needs a developed airport to be served by Ryanair, Easyjet etc to give everyone another option to get to and from the Island.
attributes.additional_details:
The Channel Islands which are smaller and have fewer events and far fewer tourists have the option of flights or ferries.

The Isle Of Skye has a fixed link or ferries as options.
It really doesn't feel that the Isle Of Wight's population or visitors are given the support that the aforementioned Islands receive with regards to options of transport to and from the Island at a fair price. We are held to ransom by the ferry companies as that's the only option we have available to us.

attributes.action: Make food and drink labelling more specific when stating may contain nuts
attributes.background: So many packaging contains the phrase “may contain nuts”. This needs to be more specific as someone with a peanut allergy may not have an allergy to any other nuts but won’t buy the product because it’s not specific enough even though this particular nut may not be present.
attributes.additional_details: most manufacturers use the term “may contain nuts” for example brands such as Cadbury, Kellogg’s, Peters pies the list goes on. The labelling has been seen on yoghurt, cereals, baked goods and even bread. People with a certain nut allergy should be able to look at the packaging and see what nuts could be present so that they’re not excluded from all nuts that they are able to consume

attributes.action: Ensure British food standards are met in any free trade agreement with USA
attributes.background: Once 'Brexit' is complete the government will be able to seek its own Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) with other countries, most notably the USA. The USA use hormones in the rearing of their meat, Genetically Modified vegetables, and have low animal welfare requirements.
attributes.additional_details: We want all food in Britain to adhere to our standards. We do not want chicken that has been washed in chlorine, we do not want beef which has been injected with hormones, we do not want pigs who have suffered horrendous conditions to be allowed to arrive in the UK. Raising and management of animal products in this way goes against the values that the British public hold. We hold our government accountable for protecting these values.

attributes.action: Make public, communal eating space a legal requirement in high density housing.
attributes.background: A study found that regularly eating meals alone is the biggest single factor for unhappiness, besides existing mental illness. When we only design commercial spaces for individualised food consumption and cooking spaces for the single person, we are designing unhappiness.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it should be a legal requirement for housing developments of any significant density, to provide large social eating spaces and communal kitchens, in which inhabitants can cook for one another, socialise and share food freely. This will avoid public health concerns such as social isolation.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/23/the-friend-effect-why-the-secret-of-health-and-happiness-is-surprisingly-simple
 
foodhallproject.org

attributes.action: Make private holiday companies who also provide care, be registered with the CQC
attributes.background: There are far too many private holiday providers who are providing care, as part of a packaged holiday to vulnerable adults with learning disabilities, autism and other disabilities They are unregistered and therefore unregulated by the Care Quality Commission and are charging for the care provided.

attributes.action: Ban diet companies from promoting their products on social media
attributes.background:
Eating disorders are causing people all over the world to lose their lives. 

Diet companies promoting their products on social media are directly influencing young people to purchase harmful products such as ‘appetite suppressants’ - which will ultimately lead them to develop disordered eating.

attributes.action: The UK should create a Blockchain Act to support the new tokenized economy
attributes.background: Our legal infrastructure needs to provide a foundation for proper digital signing with private keys, and support the legal consequences of the ownership, possession and transfer of tokens.
attributes.additional_details:
A Blockchain Act will support the new tokenized economy, and where real-world applications around blockchain can be enacted with legal certainty. These tokens include: payment tokens (currency coins); utility tokens (services); and security tokens (equity and assets). 

Liechtenstein's Blockchain Act defines its objective as to:

"enable the transformation of the ‘real’ world to blockchain systems while ensuring legal certainty, thereby opening up the full application potential of the token economy."

The UK Act should aim to define “legal certainty” for blockchain implementation and projects, and define a world where our existing assets are added onto blockchain, and then traded there.

attributes.action: Urge food manufacturers to reduce the amount of added sugar in yoghurt & cereal
attributes.background:
There has been a lot of coverage in the press about the 'sugar drinks tax'. Per 100g some cereals contain just as much sugar, if not more than some of these sugary drinks. 
I want the government to call on food manufacturers to reduce the amount of added sugar in yoghurts and breakfast cereals.
attributes.additional_details:
Some cereals that are aimed at young children have just as much, if not more, added sugar than some sugary drinks. 
 
Coca cola contains 10.6g of sugar per 100ml 
Tesco Multigrain Boulders contain 25g sugar per 100g 
Crunchy Nut clusters contain 31g sugar per 100g 
Frosties contain 37g sugar per 100g
 
A decent breakfast is vital for children going into school.
 
I believe that cereals should have a reduced amount of added sugar in order to help tackle the UKs obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Intervene in the management of Bishop Auckland General Hospital.
attributes.background: Since Bishop Auckland General Hospital merged in to County Durham & Darlington NHS Trust, services have been lost and ward closures have become the normality. The hospital is now unable to serve the town and area.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must work with NHS Improvement to investigate these failings, and if necessary consider removing the trust’s responsibility for Bishop Auckland General Hospital.

attributes.action: DfE: add a clear definition of Order of Operations to National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Current National Curriculum does not provide information on what Order of Operations should be in maths. Most students and teachers use BODMAS to remember the sequence but, unfortunately, some of them understand the order too literally and therefore are not able to complete simple maths sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of study resources omit ( or do not detail enough) the fact that Division and Multiplication, as well as Addition and Subtraction, are equally ranked and have to be completed left-to-right. Many students, and unfortunately, some teachers, understand the order too literally, calculating Addition before Subtraction getting wrong answers for simple maths sentences. 
We are worried about future of our kids, who will have to pass their exams to get into higher education.

attributes.action: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.background: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.additional_details:
Right to 28 days to repay prescription charges:

Temporary financial difficulties happen to us all at some point in our lives, and being struck by one can be made worse when you become ill but don't qualify for financial support. I would like to propose that there be made available a 28 day period of grace for all citizens to pay prescription charges after the receipt of items. No one should be left without medical care because of a short term financial crisis. 
So those who desperately need medical help can receive it and re-pay within their next pay period.

attributes.action: Lower the age for breast cancer screening and make it more frequent
attributes.background:
My mum was diagnosed with Breast cancer after a routine screening which showed a 50p size lump in the middle of her breast. 
My mum was diagnosed with stage 4 terminal cancer that had spread to her liver and lungs. She later passed away.
If I can help anyone it’s worth a try
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 454,000 cases of breast cancer every year in the UK and 1 in 8 people are likely to contract the disease in their life. 
If we can find it early we can not only save peoples lives but save the NHS money

attributes.action: Legalise the use of batons by private security staff
attributes.background: Make the use and possession of extendable batons legal for licensed security staff after completing a training course.

attributes.action: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400.
attributes.background: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400. its unfair it has to be paid on the second 2.5 year spouse visa WHICH PARTNERS ARE already paying towards the nhs through national insurance and tax through jobs so its unfair they have to pay extra nhs money

attributes.action: Introduce a plastic deposit return scheme in major supermarkets
attributes.background: The Government must work with supermarkets to introduce a plastic bottle return scheme. Almost 36 million plastic bottles are bought every day in the UK. Less than half are recycled. 35 countries use this scheme, with Norway recycling 96% of their plastic (Sky Ocean Rescue, 2018).
attributes.additional_details: Plastic now ends up in our foods and this is dangerous to us. If other countries can do it then so can we! Floating plastic becomes brittle in sunlight and then slowly breaks up into ever-smaller pieces as it is churned up by waves. It can take centuries to break down. Many scientists believe plastic never completely disappears - particularly if it's submerged in deep or cold water. A drink bottle can take 450 years to break down, while a plastic fishing line could last for 600 years. (Sky Ocean Rescue, 2018)

attributes.action: Add an exemption to the Ivory Bill for the Sikh Kirpan.
attributes.background: Baptised Sikhs are permitted by UK law to carry the ceremonial knife called the Kirpan. Many Kirpans are inherited heirlooms & most historic, antique versions contain ivory handles. We want exemption for Sikhs to be able to carry previously, legally purchased antique Kirpans under the new ivory law.
attributes.additional_details: We do not support the trade in ivory, we are only requesting protection & continued freedom of use of any antique Kirpan legally owned before the new ivory law comes into action. As mentioned, historic Kirpans could contain more than 10% ivory. As many practicing Sikhs will continue to travel abroad, we are very concerned that the Kirpan, if constructed of ivory may be confiscated or destroyed. We request that suitable exemptions are put in place to avoid disruption to the Sikh community.

attributes.action: Stop the slaughtering of farmed animals for human consumption.
attributes.background: Animals are forcibly impregnated, kept in closed and confined spaces, stunned (although in some cases like Halal slaughterhouses they are not stunned) and slaughtered.
attributes.additional_details:
As the superior species, we should help and protect animals now that we have adapted to create alternatives, like burgers out of plant foods!
 
Relevant documentaries:
Cowspiracy Documentary:  https://www.netflix.com/title/80033772 
What the Health: https://www.netflix.com/title/80174177?s=i”

attributes.action: PM to honour promise: BREXIT negotiated by Sen. Sec. of State who voted leave
attributes.background: The Prime Minister, by announcing that she will lead negotiations with the EU, while DExEU will only prepare, has broken her promise and lost the trust of the voting public and a significant part of her party and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: In June 2016, Theresa May promised that, "Brexit means Brexit". In the same speech, she promised, "I will therefore create a new government department responsible for conducting Britain’s negotiation with the EU and for supporting the rest of Whitehall in its European work. That department will be lead by a senior secretary of state and I will make sure that the position is taken by a Member of Parliament who campaigned for Britain to leave the EU."

attributes.action: Make all school holidays (primary and secondary) across the UK, the same.
attributes.background: To make the lives of all parents and carers logistically easier and for families to all be able to enjoy school holidays TOGETHER... we need to standardise school holidays so that all UK schools take their holidays at the same time.
attributes.additional_details:
It is not uncommon for parents to have both a primary aged child and a secondary aged child - who’s schools have their half term holidays on different weeks.

Furthermore, teachers who have children of their own, often find themselves receiving a half term holiday at a different time to their own children - who may be at school in a neighbouring town or city for example.

attributes.action: Provide more support to put an end to modern slavery in Libya
attributes.background: Last year CNN released video footage of Black African migrants being bought and sold in to slavery in Libya. The horrific events happened openly in slave auctions and migrants were being sold for as little as $400. There were also many accounts that women and girls were being sold in to sex slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It has now been almost a year since the release of the slave auction video footage. The media's interest has significantly lessened, and public discussion has waned.

I am therefore asking the UK government to again put pressure on Libya to put an end to modern-day slavery. I am also asking the UK government to provide the public with a full and transparent update on the UK emergency interventions and UK programmes designed to specifically target Black African migrants and refugees in Libya, including a response containing details of further plans to support the complete eradication of modern slavery in the region.

https://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/14/africa/libya-migrant-auctions/index.html

attributes.action: Increase Defence spending to at least 2.5% of GDP per year
attributes.background: If the U.K. wants to maintain its global influence, it must increase its defence budget, rather than continue to cut it.
